name: Git
description: A free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

name: Repository
description: A central location where Git stores all the files and history for a project.

name: Commit
description: A snapshot of the changes made to a project at a particular point in time. Each commit has a unique ID and a message describing the changes made.

name: Branch
description: A parallel version of a repository that allows developers to work on different features or versions of a project simultaneously without affecting the main codebase.

name: Merge
description: The process of combining changes from one branch into another, typically used to incorporate new features or fixes from a development branch into the main branch.

name: Pull Request
description: A request to merge changes made in a branch into another branch, typically used to propose changes to the main codebase and to initiate a code review process.

name: Push
description: The process of sending commits from a local repository to a remote repository, typically used to share changes with other developers working on the same project.

name: Clone
description: The process of creating a local copy of a remote repository, typically used to begin working on a project or to make a backup of an existing repository.

name: Fork
description: A copy of a repository that allows developers to freely experiment with changes without affecting the original codebase.

name: Tag
description: A label assigned to a specific commit to mark a significant point in the project's history, typically used to denote a release or a major change.
